title: User acceptance of reusable respirators in health care
text: Thus, the health care sector must plan to address these foreseeable shortages
authors: Hines, Stella E.; Brown, Clayton; Oliver, Marc; Gucer, Patricia; Frisch, Melissa; Hogan, Regina; Roth, Tracy; Chang, James; McDiarmid, Melissa

title: Public Understanding of Medical Countermeasures
text:
Prior research linked high public anxiety to crisis and emergency risk communication
 1, 2 Ongoing research is developing medical countermeasures deployable in public health emergencies, enabling the best emergency medicines and tools to be available when disaster strikes
authors: Liu, Brooke Fisher; Quinn, Sandra C.; Egnoto, Michael; Freimuth, Vicki; Boonchaisri, Natalie

title: Personal Protective Equipment: Protecting Health Care Providers in an Ebola Outbreak
text: The recent Ebola epidemic that devastated West Africa evolved within months from a regional humanitarian crisis to a global public health emergency
authors: Fischer, William A.; Weber, David J.; Wohl, David A.

title: Resistance to synthetic blood penetration of National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators and surgical N95 respirators
text: The extensive use of surgical N95 FFRs in surgical and nonsurgical health care practices results in shortages during emergencies and pandemic events involving a respiratory pathogen
authors: Rengasamy, Samy; Sbarra, Deborah; Nwoko, Julian; Shaffer, Ronald

title: Health care workers' perceptions of respiratory and gastrointestinal algorithms for patient management in emergency care settings
text: The current study advances knowledge surrounding HCWs perceptions of organizational-specific guidelines for managing patients with suspected communicable respiratory and GI illnesses in emergency departments
authors: Siow, Serena; Bryce, Elizabeth A.; Scharf, Sydney
